docs.title: Hongfu Sun
docs.text:
Senior Lecturer · Medical Imaging & AI · University of Newcastle

Email · Google Scholar · GitHub · ORCID

I work at the intersection of MRI physics and machine learning, with focus on Quantitative Susceptibility Mapping (QSM), R2* mapping, and AI-guided reconstruction for faster, more robust, and more accessible MRI.

docs.text:
Senior Lecturer, School of Engineering, University of Newcastle (Australia)

  • Research areas: MRI physics, QSM, R2* mapping, AI for image reconstruction
  • Affiliations: University of Newcastle; Honorary Senior Research Fellow, UQ

docs.title: Research
docs.text: Themes: Smart MRI • AI-guided acquisition • Physics-aware reconstruction • Portable/low-field MRI

docs.title: Current directions
docs.text:
• QSM & iron mapping: physics-informed models and deep generative reconstruction.
  • R2* relaxometry: robust mapping under reduced echoes and low SNR.
  • Portable MRI for stroke triage: combining acquisition policies with efficient recon.

docs.title: Selected projects
docs.text:
• QSMDiff: Diffusion-based QSM inversion.
  • DeepRelaxo: Fast, robust R2* mapping under variable echoes.
  • DIP-UP: Deep Image Prior for Phase Unwrapping.

docs.title: Software
docs.text:
• DeepRelaxo — Robust R2* mapping under variable echoes. [repo link]
  • QSMDiff — Diffusion-model QSM inversion. [repo link]
